intro: Marginaria auriseta, commonly known as the ear-shaped marginaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Marginaria auriseta thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
